title: Shenzhou 15 astronauts arrive at China’s space station for first crew handover
summary: China has six astronauts aboard its recently-completed space station for the first time following the arrival of three crew members aboard Shenzhou-15.

title: NASA cancels GeoCarb greenhouse gas monitoring mission
summary: NASA has canceled a greenhouse gas monitoring mission once intended to fly as a commercial hosted payload after the mission lost its ride to orbit and suffered severe cost overruns.

title: Shay Har-Noy takes the helm at Edgybees
summary: Shay Har-Noy, former Spire Global general manager for aviation and a former DigitalGlobe and Maxar Technologies vice president, has taken the helm at Edgybees, a company that specializes in aligning satellite and aerial still and full-motion imagery.

title: SpaceX delays Falcon 9 launch with private Japanese moon lander
summary: SpaceX is readying to use its reliable Falcon 9 rocket to send a privately funded mission to the surface of the moon. An initial launch window on the morning of Wednesday, Nov. 30 has been forgone “to allow for additional pre-flight checkouts.”

title: SpaceX fires up 11 engines as it prepares massive rocket for orbital test
summary: Nothing blew up, which is always a win.

title: SiriusXM orders pair of satellites to expand in Canada and Alaska
summary: SiriusXM said Nov. 29 it has ordered two more satellites from Maxar Technologies to expand its radio broadcasting constellation.

title: U.S. Space Command supports use of ‘responsive launch’ to deter China and Russia
summary: Gen. James Dickinson, head of U.S. Space Command, said the U.S. military should take advantage of commercially available launch options and vehicles that can operate from multiple locations

title: UK firm to release GEO-compatible smartphone early next year
summary: British handset maker Bullitt said Nov. 29 it will release a smartphone early next year capable of sending and receiving texts via satellites in geostationary orbit.

title: Pentagon report: China’s space strategy shaped by technological change
summary: The Pentagon in its 2022 report on China's military capabilities says the PLA continues to develop weapons for use against satellites in orbit

title: NASA to Cancel GeoCarb Mission, Expands Greenhouse Gas Portfolio
summary: NASA announced Monday it intends to cancel development of its GeoCarb mission, and instead implement a plan for pursuing alternate options to measure and observe greenhouse gases.
